review_text: We love this turntable. Great sound, easy to use and looks great!

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: I love this turntable so much! My dad had a huge record collection, but then completely forgot about them and gave them to me to hold onto. His old turntable from the early 90's was broken, so I bought this one. I'm so impressed! I love the way it sounds and it's super easy to use. The volume isn't an issue, because I just listen to it in my room, and I don't see why so many people say it's a bad turntable! It's great for starters and I love the packaging and appearance of it.

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: I recently had broken my record player that a friend had given me and had NO idea where to get a new one. The first place to start looking was obviously Amazon. I got on and found this pretty quickly by searching for the color. It was shipped quickly, in time for us to play our new record the day we got it. For not having any external speakers connected, the sound quality is great. I have it connected in my living room and can hear it from my bedroom while I'm getting ready. You can hook up external speakers if you'd like to, so that's also a cool option. All in all, I give this a 5 star rating. I can't think of anything I'd like to change and I know it also comes in different colors. It's a great product for music lovers.

review_text: I love this little cruiser! I have been playing it almost non stop since it arrived. I have several jazz albums and they all play beautifully on this player. I have it set up in my living room and I can hear it throughout my townhouse if it is on full volume. This player is VERY easy to use, and the auto stop function is very nice as well. Please keep in mind that this is an $80 player.. It's not going to be as stunning as a $400+ player. But it is a great value if you just need something for the home or office to just relax and listen. I'm thinking of buying another one for my office!

review_header: Worth it despite the negative reviews!
review_text: I was really looking into purchasing my best friend a record player for her birthday & this was one of the first I can across. Knowing her & I both were newbies to the world of record players, I really did my research on which brands were better/durable/nice sounding, etc. I was on the fence about buying this after reading the reviews (there were good AND bad) but knowing that this would be her first one on her record/vinyl journey, I went ahead & purchased this bad boy. Plus she is about to redecorate her room & the light blue color choice fit perfectly! It also sounds great! Very very well with meeting my expectations!!

review_header: I was able to return it and replace it easily! It plays wonderfully
review_text: After the first one I recieved didn't spin, I was able to return it and replace it easily! It plays wonderfully. Of course it's not going to be as good as one of the more expensive ones, but I just wanted something to play my records on in my room. This is definitely worth the price.

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_header: I love that it has the three speeds so she can ...
review_text: Our granddaughter has been pushing to hear all my old vinyl records. She loves the phonograph and left with quite a stack of vinyl for her listening pleasure. I love that it has the three speeds so she can hear old 78s, old 331/3s and 45s. I also love that it has a pocket that holds a 45 adapter right on top. It will never get lost that way. She now can enjoy our old albums, my parents old albums and my grandparents' 78s. I may get myself one of these phonographs, too. Bravo for Crosley!

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: I was so excited to receive this record player. Then I realized none of my records would play. I even bought a few new ones, still did not work. As the other reviewers said the arm is not heavy enough. HOWEVER, if you simply secure a quarter to the flat space just behind the needle on the top of the arm, they all play perfectly. I didn't want to return it, but I can see why people did. The quarter doesn't bother me, you could probably use something cooler. I hope this helps some of you enjoy your Crosley. (Ps I secured mine with a tiny price of rolled tape.)

review_text: It's exactly as the picture! It looks really cute; the turquoise color is gorgeous. Only complaint I have is that the plug has a slight, very faint ringing/buzzing noise to it when it's plugged in. You can hear the sound if you have the turntable plugged in and you're not playing any records. I've resorted to unplugging it when I'm not using it because the ringing drives me crazy. Aside from that, though, it's perfect!!

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_header: Not really portable, but not a bad turntable if you have an external speaker
review_text: First of all, be careful where you buy this from. I went to a certain place that starts with a U and ends with an rban Outfitters and paid $20 more than Amazon is charging. I can't say at all that this is a bad turntable. Sure, compared to a $1,000 player, it is probably awful. The built in speakers are just awful. They sound rejected World War II radios. But, if you plug it into an external speaker, it sounds wonderful. I have it hooked up to a Beats Pill and I'm loving how vinyl sounds through it. The real issue I have with this turntable is that, for something that is marketed as portable, it can't be used with batteries. Why market it as portable if you have to have it plugged in? That makes no sense. It has a handle, has a lid, has terrible internal speakers, and no battery compartment.

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: I got this record player as a birthday present, and after seeing the style and color I fell in love, and then I read the reviews. I was extremely discouraged at first to even play a used record on it after seeing all the complaints. When I put on the first record it sounded just fine. My friend who once bought a $500 turntable said that it sounded great even by his standards. I was ready to go online and post an awesome five star review, but then I decided to wait. When looking at all the five star reviews, it seemed like the writers just got the thing, while all the one star reviewers had owned the turntable for a while, so I decided to wait and see. I have owned the turntable for two months now and it is still playing records splendidly with only a very slight decrease in sound quality (even after playing the same used record for a month or so everyday). On new records it sounds even better. I never once had problems with skipping and the sound quality is great. If you are new to turntables, I would recommend, (especially if you are unsure if you like vinyl yet) but if you have experience and and is looking for a record player to last a lifetime, I would spend time else where.

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: I purchased this record player after having read all the reviews saying not to buy it because it was a piece of junk. With a little common sense I figured it wouldn't be a high quality product anyway; you get what you pay for. However, for never having owned a record player before (I am only 22, after all) I found it pretty easy to use and not a total waste of money. People looking to buy a record player with amazing sound quality should look into something more expensive. I bought this because I wanted that older, lesser quality sound, and that's what I got. So far I haven't had any problems with the way it handles records. A few records I bought have skips in them already but that is the fault of the record itself, not the player. The only problem I've really run into with this player is the lid. It has to be open pretty far back in order for it not to touch the record while its playing, but other than that, use the control for the needle arm, make sure there's not dust or anything sticking to the needle, use the rubber mat it comes with, and it's a pretty good quality record player for its price.

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: I'm in love with this little thing! I've been wanting to start collecting vinyl for a long time, but didn't want to do so without A.) owning a turntable and B.) starting off on the cheaper side to make sure I loved it before I went for more expensive models. A few of my friends recommended the Crosley Cruiser to me, and after thoroughly reading the reviews (yes, even the bad ones) I went for it. Now that it's here and I'm listening on it, I'm in love. I started off by just purchasing two records, Pure Heroine by Lorde, and The Acoustic Things by State Champs, and both sound amazing on this little thing! If you want loud volume, I will say that this turntable can be for you too! I personally prefer my music at a more comfortable volume so the built in speakers work great for me, but you can hook it up to speakers as well, so you're still getting the loud volume if you want. It came shipped so well, and I had it out of the box and ready to use within five minutes. I'm already shopping for more records thanks to this thing, and I'm very happy I chose it as my starter model. One day I'll get a more expensive and professional turntable, but this little thing is doing wonders for me so far!

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: Great gift along with affordability

product_name: crosley cr8005a-tu cruiser portable 3-speed turntable, turquoise
review_text: pretty good overall, you're going to want to buy external speakers for it for better sound projection. plays properly, the turntable itself (spinning part) measures about 6 1/2 inches and the record is stable and sticks out the edge. comes with a 45 adapter in it which is great. if you are going to mix songs, do not buy this record player. if you plan on dj-ing or just mixing songs, you cannot turn a record backwards. you cannot make it spin the opposite direction.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Sounds awesome, bad charging port design.
review_text: Just decent. Pros: Very resilient, sound great for their size, easy to operate. Cons: I bought 2 of them. One had a defective battery, the other eventually broke the USB socket because the design has insufficient clearance to most USB plugs. I think this is why they stop charging and won't turn on after a year or so. You'll enjoy it while it lasts, but don't expect it to last forever. If not for the design defect in the charging port, this would be an excellent product.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: Sound quality isn't great. Barely any bass to speak of which leaves the music feeling a bit empty. That is my only complaint but I think it is sufficient to justify a 3. The price, size and Bluetooth capabilities of this are nice but as a stand alone speaker its not great. I own two of these, one I gave to my mom as standalone speaker, thats the 3 stars. But my second one i have plugged directly into my stereo system so this effectively acts as a Bluetooth receiver for any device. I play my music through this which is plugged into the stereo so I get the full sound. Its good for that but you don't need the $50 thing to just use it as a Bluetooth receiver anyway. Its ok, you won't return it but maybe look for another one in the $75 range if you want better sound quality

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Minus volume button is very bad
review_text: I just got one of these as a gift from work. While it works fine. You can use to call through, it sounds fine to me but the other person will hear themselves as they are talking to you. That's fine as its main purpose isn't to be used as Bluetooth for phone call. What really bugs me is the minus volume button. All the other buttons have a very audiable click and you can feel the button being depressed, but the minus volume button doesn't have that click sound or feel. Also the other buttons are 1 hand operational while the minus button I have to use 2 hands to push it. Also I'm not a small guy I'm 6ft 240# and go to the gym 6 days a week. I feel like I might have got a defective one where they actually forgot to but the button on the minus volume and that's why I have to push so hard. If thats how its suppose to be its a bad design it hurts my fingers to lower the volume. Its like trying to load that last cartridge in brand new magazine if you know what I mean lol

review_text: **Update - 4/20/208: I’m removing 2 stars because it won’t pair with my Amazon Exho Dot AND it wouldn’t pair with a friend’s IPhone 7 on a recent camping trip. Aside from these issues, it’s great but being that for this speaker to even work, it has to connect to devices. Get that fixed JBL. You’re either Bluetooth or you’re not. I work in production (sound, staging and lighting) so we know the JBL brand very well. This little speaker really packs a punch. So much so that we turned around and bought everyone at work one for their Christmas stocking stuffer. I’ll be using mine in my small RV. Perfect size for camping and outdoor fun.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: For the price not great sound quality; also misleading Factory Re-Certified
review_text: Looks great, loved the clip and build and size BUT not the sound quality. Bought this as a gift for my daughter - Sound is good but not for all sounds. I am no audiophile - Mid tones, vocal are great, say Adele or Jason Mraz, (but not roy orbison) bass is decent but the moment there is music and a variety of instruments it feels more like noise the whole quality goes down. Its NOT bad at all but instead of spending $60 on this I would rather try a different brand that is lot cheaper and has decent reviews. Also those that are sold for $45/49 are Factory Re-Certified - I dont mind fact re-certified but it should have been explicitly mentioned, it was not obvious to me, but the factory re-certified is right on the box direct from JBL (see pic) - but this can be used for as a price match at your local store :) your mileage may vary.

Audio is choppy when passing through one wall made of simple sheet rock and at a distance of less than 2 meters. Audio is distorted when connected via bluetooth AND bluetooth range is terrible JBL online chat told me that they were sorry that "the product did not meet my expectations". My expectations were low, just wanted it to work. DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.

review_header: This product may be Counterfeit. Buy it direct from JBL.
review_text: I purchased a JBL Clip 2 at the JBL store and it has a battery life of 2-3 days of use. I purchased this version to have a second to "daisy-chain" and like many of the low rating reviews have stated, the battery life is only a few hours. This is not comparable to my first unit. This model is also more slow and fussy to maintain blue tooth connection than my JBL store purchased model. I think this may be a counterfeit version. It is a great speaker, I just would not buy it here.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: I love the design. The wrap-around aux cable is awesome. It sounded great, was portable and presumably waterproof. Unfortunately, I encountered a defect where it would continuously alternate flashing red and blue (maybe trying to connect to bluetooth) which essentially meant broken. It wouldn't connect to bluetooth, the aux input was disabled, and there's no way to forcefully reset or power off the device. Great stuff but this hangup left me with a paperweight. Would buy again if the defects were ironed out but for now I can't trust it anymore. Even if I waited for the battery to die, is it going to brick itself when I'm on vacation with no way to just power it off?

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: JBL Makes Weak Products For The Price
review_text: I've tested and compared about a dozen wireless headsets and the JBL sound quality was always among the bottom sets and always overpriced for the quality of the product. Many other brands made better quality products for the price. The same with this speaker. I compared this ~$50 JBL to the ~$50 UE-Roll2 and ~$50 Altec Lansing and this came out as the clear bottom. It has the weakest "in the can" sound and as you turn the volume up louder, its weaknesses become even more apparent. Of the 3, the Altec Lansing-The Jacket H2O 3 is BY FAR the best and highest sound quality. Both the JBL and the Altec Lansing work with your cell phone, adjust volume and skip/goback to the next song. The Altec Lansing reaches a louder clear volume. The UE-Roll2 does not and it also doesn't skip to the next song.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: The cover just fell of on a regular workday .Went throughout all where I was today. Could not be found. Bummed its useless for me now.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: I like this speaker because it is waterproof, small, and convenient. Also, has great sound quality for a speaker of this size. Perfect for hikes since you can easily clip to your backpack! The biggest downfall is that mine just randomly stopped charging after only 8 months of use. Maybe I got a defective one, but I was expecting this speaker to last for a couple years at least. Especially with JBL quality. Another downfall is that the charge (when it worked) would only hold for a few hours. Not 8 like advertised. I would only recommend this speaker for travel. Not suitable for daily use in my opinion.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: NOT impressed. Maybe you can help?
review_text: Not impressed... For now. I believe I received what is commonly called a dud. The speaker would pair perfectly fine with me Galaxy S7. The issues began when I tried playing music. It would play for a split second, at a low volume, then stop. It wouldn't play longer then that, or louder than a slighter whisper. The AUX cord was the exact same. The charging was not successful either: it would turn a red light on for about 45 seconds, then go completely black. I purchased the item from a base exchange. I'll return it in two days, until then I'm out 50 bucks and stuck with a horrifically malfunctioning speaker.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Don't get this as a guitar monitor.
review_text: Great speaker, depending on what you want it for. I wanted a small battery powered monitor for practicing guitar. I had been told that the previous product (JBL Clip) had no latency using the 3.5mm cable. I took a chance that the Clip 2 would be the same. It's not. The long delay when using the cable renders it unfit for purpose. In fairness, if you just want a portable speaker to listen to your tunes, the Clip 2 is pretty nice. I'm keeping it for that more conventional use.

JBL please splurge and use something with a little quality. I can tell that the USB end of the cord is cheap and doesn't have a secure connection like other USB cables. Cheap never wins! I changed my mind after writing this I decided to rate it a 1 because I expect more from JBL.

It would be good for outdoor activities.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: Am returning mine for two reasons: volume is not as loud as I expected, and the forward facing speaker does not spread the sound around as well as cheaper units such as the $20 iHome speakers (non-Bluetooth). If I tried to listen to this speaker while bike riding I now realize I'd hardly be able to hear it. I think these speakers have been over-hyped.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Bought a pair these... both won't connect via Bluetooth
review_text: I bought a pair of these. One speaker never connected to anything (The Grey one being reviewed) and the other will only connect to one Bluetooth devices out seven that I tried, including computers. The 'daisy-chain' function works when we got the one device to connect though. The Clip 2 basically only works via the 3.5mm audiojack, but that's not why I bought them. Furthermore the integrated audiojack cable is short and flimsy which means it will inevitably fray and wont be able to replace the cable turning them into a pair of paperweights (I'm working abroad and can't return them anytime soon). Supremely disappointed in JBL and regret not spending the extra money on a more reliable competitor's product.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: Fair, after 15 minutes or so it goes to static and needs to be turned off and back on again. Wouldn't buy it again.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: it is in perfect sync. But when daisy-chained
review_text: CAREFUL, it lags when daisy chained! When playing any video with just one speaker from my IPhone 6, it is in perfect sync. But when daisy-chained, there is a noticeable and extremely annoying lag, making it nearly impossible to watch the video. I am giving this one star to put readers (and JBL! Why didn't you admit this on your product information??) on notice. Otherwise, the speaker quality itself is good. BUT if you are buying to daisy chain two speakers and watch something, it is terrible. UPDATED: Too bad I can't write two reviews. One would be five stars, the other one star. Five for a great-sounding and expertly designed speaker. One for the lag when watching a video with daisy-chained speakers.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: JBL get your Blutooth pairing right
review_text: I have now purchased and returned 3 count them 3 different models of JBL portable Bluetooth speakers. This is by far the worst. Dropped signals. Refusal to pair correctly with iPhone 6 or iPad Air 2. It has major problem with YouTube especially when you forward or rewind a video which I do often. When it did pair it was decent but by day 2 I had already printed the return label. Nice colors nice form factor ultraportable but if the Bluetooth functionality is flawed the rest of its features hardly matter. This flaw is throughout your product line. I have a Big blue Party, BRV XXL, Monster Superstar, Bose Soundlink 3, Jawbone Big Jambox, and never ever had Bluetooth functionality issues. Very sad indeed.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: I bought this speaker for biking and camping and paddle boarding — as well as to loan to my 10 year old music lover when he’s wants to take music outside. In our house, we are Bose fans ( we own and love the Bose Mini Soundlink and the Bose Soundtouch but I didn’t like the price, reviews, or look of the Bose waterproof Soundlink Micro. I didn’t want to spend $99 for “Bose with a cold” as one reviewer said nor did I want to hand over something that cost $99 to my son. Anyway, long story short, I decided to give this JBL a try. So far, it’s uh-maaaaaaazing. Honestly, I’m shocked by how great this TINY speaker sounds. Also, it paired truly effortlessly with both my 2018 iPhone and my son’s 2017 kindle. I can’t yet speak to its long term durability when it comes to biking, camping and paddle boarding, but so far, for the price point, I’m super impressed by the sound and quality. I say buy.

I got sick-n-tired of trying to plug the silly thing in, when it made it's little 'time to recharge' chiming sound. Sigh. With the charging cable inserted, it is bothersome to turn on/off the device (since the cable drapes over the on/off indentation. So, sadly, every time I turn the device on, I have to pick it up, move the cable aside, then press the on/off indentation.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: This speaker is AMAZING! It's compact, has great battery life, and is loud! I use it in the shower and even tested it in a bowl of water, and it still works totally fine. The clip is very useful for when I want to clip it to one of my drawers while I'm doing chores. I've also used it on walks where I clip it to my key chain around my neck. The only con I can say is that of course for it's size, you're not getting thumpy or heavy bass, so if you're a bass head, then this speaker might not be for you. On the flip side, the sound quality is clear and crisp, with no distortion as high volumes. I also bought a case for the speaker to keep it protected. The speaker also comes with an auxiliary cable wrapped around it if you want to use it for older mp3 players. Overall, I'd say JBL knows what they're doing when it comes to sound quality. I can only imagine what the JBL Clip 3 would sound like! FitSand (TM) Portable Travel Carry Zipper Protective EVA Hard Case Cover Bag Box for JBL Clip 2 Waterproof Portable Bluetooth Speaker

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Great speaker, especially for the price. There is one thing to take not of regarding the audio cable.
review_text: Great speaker for the price. I wish there was a little more bass, but it probably wouldn't be possible based on the size and price. At least the bass that is present isn't distorted. The bass and highs sound very good, but the mids might be a little low, but again the speaker sounds really good. The speaker is loud enough for a small room, but wouldn't fill up a large room. The speaker is definitely beautiful and the clip is nice and sturdy. The material it is made out of feels nice to the touch and seems to be high quality. One thing to note, this may be different than some Bluetooth headphones you may be used to regarding the built-in audio cord/cable. The Sony Bluetooth headphones I have are not required to be turned on or connected via Bluetooth to anything if I have an audio cable plugged in to them directly. That is not the case with this speaker though. Even if I have the speaker connected via the audio cable to an MP3 player, it must be turned on and it will automatically pair/connect with your phone. This can be annoying if you are using a separate MP3 player and a phone call comes in to your phone which was previously paired to the speaker. Not a deal breaker, but something to make note of.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Pleasant sounding compact Bluetooth-Wired speaker that needs 3.5 mm input port
review_text: JBL Clip 2 is gives pleasant and loud sound without heavy bass. I removed the clip, substituting a short shoelace with lobster clasps at the ends to hook onto itself. I placed masking tape over the controls writing the letters U, D, P, BT to help me learn the location of controls. The little indicator light blinks slowly for power with wire and faster for power with Bluetooth. I like the fact that the speaker does have a power switch. I am displeased with the attached.3.5mm input cable, as I think that sooner or later the cable will fail and I will have to throw the speaker away. I have taped the wire to the back of the speaker inside its well to reduce strain. I would love to see a3.5 mm input port as found on some other speakers. This is a nice, lightweight and full-sounding speaker that I attach to my Fire tablet or phone finger-strap.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: A wonderful little speaker! It packs a good amount of punch for its size. While it does lack some bass, I fully expected it to, considering the size of the package, but for an average music-listener it's not too much of a loss. The mids and highs are vibrant; I love watching videos on my phone while connected to this speaker. My main reason for my purchase of this little guy, however, came down to practicality. I'm a fairly clumsy person, so I wanted something that could withstand the elements and a handful of falls. This speaker is perfect for that: it's truly waterproof, so I don't have to worry about it getting wet in the Seattle rain or the shower, and it's rugged as hell. I have yet to drop it, but I have confidence that it'll survive any drops from a reasonable height. The carabiner clip and the built-in aux cord make this speaker all the more convenient! I may have to buy a second just to mess with the daisy chaining capabilities. A very worthwhile product!

review_text: Perfect speaker with great sound especially for the beach or travel. The battery life was very good as well. Mine lasted about 4 hrs. This is the forth JBL Bluetooth speaker I've purchased over the years as gifts and personal. I highly recommend it.

review_text: I received one of these as a gift for being a Subaru Ambassador. I wasn't expecting too much but I figured it was a thoughtful gift nonetheless. After opening the JBL Clip 2, I was really impressed with how they included a plug for anyone who doesn't use or have Bluetooth. It has some awesome sound for a small and affordable speaker. Currently I've been using it with my desktop computer since I'm in the middle of a move and it pumps sound out very well. I'm really impressed with this thing and would highly recommend it to anyone. **This was a gift, I did not purchase this speaker on my own.**

The sound this little guy puts out is incredible. The battery lasts forever, I've dunked it in water, and dropped it a few times and it keeps on going without issue. I'll update this review if anything changes, but for a portable, bluetooth, waterproof speaker you don't really need to look any further.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Great Sound per Pound! Great for hiking, backpacking, and camping.
review_text: Amazing sound and value! I've contemplated Bluetooth speakers such as Bose, but this fits my on-the-go needs better with its easy carabiner attachment for clipping to packs while backpacking, camping, and boating - hence the waterproof feature is essential although I haven't really tested its H20 limits. Beyond the convenient Bluetooth connectivity, it also has an (out) aux sound chord for plugging into other none-Bluetooth capable devices such as older iPods. I use mine for connecting to my iPhone or older iPod for on-the-go movie time while camping. There is a reason I see this device sold everywhere - it's got more sound per pound. Would recommend and buy again.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Must have for outdoor music lovers!
review_text: This thing is awesome! I have a small addiction to portable speakers as my two favorite hobbies involve being outdoors and listening to music so when I saw this online for $50 I couldn't resist buying it. I really like the JBL brand, they have good customer service and I personally believe they sound great and are great quality without the crazy price tag. I have two JBL FLIP 3's that I was using for hikes and fishing before I got this but ever since buying this guy I have left them at home for use in the back yard (sorry neighbors). The clip on the top makes it extremely easy to clip onto your bag or your fishing vest and the fact that it is waterproof AND floats is equally amazing. The battery life is pretty impressive for the size of the device and the amount of volume it puts out. I believe I'm getting about 6 hours if its fully charged and I have the thing turned all the way up. Another added benefit of the speaker is that if you have a friend with a 2nd CLIP 2 or you are like myself and have multiples then you can wirelessly sync them together and play the music even louder. If you are always traveling and want something that is portable or you just want quality without breaking the bank then check this guy out. You will not be disappointed!

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: Amazing sound for a small speaker. I’ve used this in the shower countless times. It has fallen ok the shower still works perfectly.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_text: This is a great speaker that can clik to a belt loop or backpack. Great sound too!

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Consider its size great speaker for the $$$
review_text: Got this for X-mas, terrific little speaker!!! I've had the original JBL micro for the past 4 years and needed an upgrade. My micro was not holding a charge for very long anymore...after 4 years of regular use, not bad at all and no complaints! The clip 2 will double my old JBL micros playtime from 4hrs to up to 8hrs of play!!! Love that the clip 2 is water proof, shock resistant and very portable. Sound is perfect for my needs especially when you consider the size of this thing. It's a very "JBL" sounding speaker, meaning it is very bright with decent bass, not a warm sound like a Bose speaker. For my use though this is perfect for cycling, by the pool and outdoors in general as it projects the sound well. Only bummer is that the bottom is not flat like my micro so it does not stand upright nor does it have a kickstand to accomplish this. I'll make due anyhow. The clip is convenient as well, attaches to almost anything. Great little speaker for the $$$

review_text: I wanted a speaker to use around the house so I can listen to podcasts or music while showering or cleaning. My phone's speaker isn't powerful enough on its own. I've bought like 3 different rubbish, no-name Bluetooth speakers in the past, but we use a bigger JBL unit at my work and it's awesome. Sooo, I splurged on this thing for myself and it's...also pretty awesome! It's not as powerful as the tube-shaped ones they make and it won't make any audiophile swoon (bass sounds a little blown out), but it's easy to use and reasonably powerful for the size. The hook is handy for attaching it to furniture or even a belt-loop on your pants. I will lose its connection if you wander too far from the device you're transmitting from like any such speaker, but it reconnects very quickly when you're in range again. I also like that it makes a little noise when its battery is running low.

review_header: Great little speaker. Good quality. Very portable.
review_text: I got this speaker a few weeks ago and have been using it a lot. It is a decent amount bigger than the last JBL Clip but is not too big or awkward and is also more sleek. The buttons are setup differently as well but overall are better because you can feel them without looking. The sound is much better than I expected from such a small speaker. The quality is clearer and there is actually some bass that can be felt/heard. I mostly use it on bike rides, while working out, in the shower or just generally on the go and the sound is perfect for all those scenarios. The carabiner feels sturdy and is bigger than on the last one so you can clip it to more things. The battery life seems pretty good. I used it a few hours a day for about 4/5 days off the original charge that it came with. I also like the fact that you can see the battery life on iOS (iPhone 6S.) I haven’t tested it in water but will update with any changes/issues.

I clip it on my golf bag behind my towel and facing towards me. So far it out lasts the phone battery easily so I am getting a different charge/case for the iphone. If I had more room (though I know a guy that just hangs his speaker in a mesh bag on the push cart) or if I wanted to spend more money I would get the JBL that charges the phone as well. That said I am happy with my purchase. I often travel with my back pack. Sometimes only with a pack. This will fit nicely clipped to a pack. Happy trails.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: For only 3 watts, this thing is LOUDER and has higher quality sound than anything comparable in price. Even a 14 watt competitor
review_text: I drive a lot during the day for work. A speaker for Bluetooth channeling of iPad audio is what I was looking for. I wanted a powerful speaker and own a JBL Clip 2 already. This little round speaker is listed as 3 Watts. I got an Oontz Angle 3 Ultra OontZ Angle 3 ULTRA Portable Bluetooth 4.2 Speaker: Excellent Stereo Sound Rich Bass 14Watt Loud Volume 100' Bluetooth Range, Play to two together, Splashproof, by Cambridge SoundWorks which is listed at 14 Watts.Same price at 3W vs. 14W? The little JBL Clip 2 is perceptibly equally loud and has better high volumes tolerance. The sound is stable at maximum volume unlike the other speaker. I've gotten it in the rain but haven't used it in the shower. I like my electronics to be waterproof regardless. This clip is ingeniously placed...all mobile speakers should have handles. Great travel speaker. Most of all, the sound quality is so far unmatched against the Altec-Lansing mini-Lifejacket, Philips BT3500B/37 and the Ooztz 3 Ultra. Much clearer with less distortion with just 3W. I'd like to compare this to comparably Bose SoundLink Micro Waterproof Bluetooth speaker - Black . If anyone has done a comparison, leave a comment please. I found out it's not worth using bluetooth at all and that just plugging a double ended 1.5mm headphone cord into the CAR STEREO AUX jack and the other end into the iPad/iPhone. *Set the phone/iPad volume to max and use the car stereo volume control to adjust volume. It is, hands down, the easiest, cheapest way to play music in a car with an iPhone or iPad. I'll use this one while hiking and transport it back and forth to my desk where it hangs. The other's I'll sell.

review_text: Amazing speaker. It sounds great, feels really rugged. The water resistance is an awesome feature. I originally had the JBL Clip+, which recently died on me. I decided to upgrade to this, considering how good the Clip+ had been. This only improves on the original. The clip 2 has an upgraded design, and fixes all of the qualms I had with the Clip+. These were namely the lack of water resistance and the poor quality clip. The speaker sounds great, and can fill a small room. I love it and use it daily. The only "qualm" I have with this one is that the status light is on the bottom, not on the top like the old model. This is probably because of water resistance purposes, but I liked the light on the top more.

product_name: jbl clip 2 waterproof portable bluetooth speaker (teal)
review_header: Works and sounds great. I had a sound link mini
review_text: Bought this about a month ago to have a portable speaker hang onto my tool belt. Works and sounds great. I had a sound link mini, which sounds fantastic, but it was just too damn heavy to carry around and I also wasn't able to charge it via USB (needs to plug into outlet). So I bought this and plenty of other small, USB charged portable speakers and the Clip 2 BY FAR sound the best out of the other ones of which I've returned. For its size, it's handles bass very well with very little distortion, even at high volumes, all while having the clarity music deserve. And believe me, this thing get loud! It's extremely light, 10 hr battery, USB charged, waterproof, can also be daisy-chained, and all under 50 bucks. Again, for ITS SIZE AND PRICE, it's the best little speaker out there hands down.

review_header: For morning smoothies this blender is very big, taking ...
review_text: For morning smoothies this blender is very big, taking up a lot of space and making it very hard to wash without a dishwasher.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: This blender is absolutely excellent if you exclusively use it to blend whole pieces of fruit and veggies. Personally I make a lot of smoothies with items such as yogurt and protein powder added in. The trouble is it has this very long three bladed pillar that extends almost all the way to the lid from the bottom. If you are trying to add in a powder or something like yogurt, it catches on all the blades, which means that unless you planned to fill the blender all the way to the top, that stuff won't make it into your smoothie and will instead stick and you have to scrape it in and blend again. Also it's ridiculously powerful even on the low setting, which again isn't good if you only want to make less than maximum capacity, since it splatters everywhere and you either lose a lot, or have to sit there and scrape it all out with a spatula. Overall it's just a lot of trouble unless you are using it to full capacity every time.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: Used it last week and it worked great.
review_text: This is my second time using this blender and the top half is stuck on and it won't even turn on. The power light just flashes. Used it last week and it worked great.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: Cracked and leaking after less than a month's use
review_text: I was very happy with this blender when I first tried it. I have always had 20 dollar blenders so this was a step up because it is much more powerful. I make smoothies and blend cauliflower for mash sometimes, but the primary reason for purchase was to make bulletproof coffee every morning. Upon first use for BP coffee it produced froth like I have never had and it was truly delicious. The reason I landed on this blender is because after doing research for the best blender specifically for BP coffee this was recommended if you are not willing to splurge for a Vitamix or Blendtec. At this point, I may have to do that, because even this blender has already cracked and is leaking after less than a month's use. Luckily I am still in the return frame for Amazon so they are sending me a new one (I also purchased warranty). Upon doing more research, people say in order to keep blenders from cracking when making BP coffee, you must release the air pressure out of the blender by taking off the top after no more than blending for 10 seconds. Then you can put the top back on and blend for additional time if needed. I am going to try this method, and hopefully it will keep it from cracking.

review_text: Pros: easy to use, cleans easy in dishwasher, blends thoroughly, safe locking/starting mechanism Cons: Ninja customer service is a joke if something fails. Weak pitcher latch on ours broke 45 days after purchase & was told a replacement pitcher was $65, Warranty was only valid if purchased directly from them and only covered the motor/base: lid and pitcher are not. No 60 day guarantee or years warranty.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: Updating my review 1.5 years after purchase. I loved my blender, but it literally broke into pieces after only a year and change. A few months after I got it, a crack started to form and eventually just broke wide open. Keep in mind, I only used this to make smoothies, it wasn't heavily used or anything. I'm so disappointed. My thrift store blender lasted longer than this. I expect much more for this price.

review_text: It blends well. I don't like cleaning the blade because it's easy to get cut.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: But this is such a horrible blender for what you pay
review_text: I never write reviews. But this is such a horrible blender for what you pay, I had to write a review. Another reviewer wrote “it takes the smooth out of smoothie” and he couldn’t be more right. I’m not sure how this blender got so many good reviews. So many times I tried making my smoothies and açaí bowls and had to stick a spoon in the blender and push all the chunks to the center because they wouldn’t blend. I end up dumping my smoothie into my nitribullet to get all the chunks out of it. The designers went wrong when they decided to put three sets of blades going up...all it does is send everything flying to the sides, making me have to constantly scrape the sides of the blender. The lowest setting is still too high! Ugh! I need a vitamix.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: Dead on arrival, terrible customer service with phone numbers hard to get through.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: I loved this blender when I first bought it BUT after ...
review_text: I loved this blender when I first bought it BUT after owning it for only a few monthsw I found that this dishwasher safe blender is not dishwasher safe. I always place the lid and blades on the top rack but the Main part of the blender can only fit on the lower rack. Over weveral washings it melted it just enough that the lid would no longer go on. I called ninja and they replaced it but told me that it could only be replaced one time per costomer. I never put my new one in the dishwasher. But after a few months of using it it was also defective. I was blending frozen fruit for a smoothie and the plastic sides just exploded open. It is no longer usable. This blender is too expensive for the short amount of time that it it will last. Don't buy it.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: The pitcher literally cracked after the third use with frozen fruit.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: 1,000 WATTS for a fraction of the price of the expensive one! You can't get a more powerful, quality blender for the price.
review_text: I purchased the other Ninja set "master prep pro" a while ago. I love it, use it a lot, but decided I wanted a tall blender. Of course I picked the Ninja. First of all, look at the price and watts on this! 1,000 watts for soooo much less than the Vitamix. The newest Vitamix is 2.2 HP (1640 Watts) for over $600! Yikes. Don't get me wrong, they are a great machine, but for those of us who don't need programmable timers, hot soup and ultra silky smooth baby food, this Ninja is the best out there. This does just about everything the high priced one does. I use this for smoothies, this can take anything you give it and blend it right up. I make frozen fruit yogurts, (add the frozen fruit to fat free yogurt (I use home made almond milk yogurt). I use it for banana "icecream". Whip up frozen banana pieces, takes a couple seconds with this, then add peanut butter, chocolate, nuts, whatever you want. (I use Betty Lou's powdered fat free peanut butter). Of course you have to be careful handling the ultra sharp blades. I remove the blade assembly by the tip and set it inside the sink. I continue to hold just the top tip and use a bottle brush to clean the blades. I carefully set it back in the clean blender and let it air dry. It doesn't rust. I also make my own sauces and dressings. The grand kids like the "snow cones" this Ninja makes. I use diluted, sugar free Torani, and DaVinci coffee syrups, (brands Amazon carries). I especially like the simplicity of the buttons. Low, medium and high. Full speed and pulse. What more does anyone need? You just can't get a more powerful, quality blender than this for the price. Update: Well, it did blend the soft frozen fruit (banana, strawberries and blueberries), but I later tried mango and pineapple. Not so good. Chunks no matter how long I blended. I guess it has limitations.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: This Item DIDN't WORK! Can seem to be able to return it!

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: This is a poorly designed blender. The owner's guide says the pitcher is dishwasher safe. However, the four corners of the pitcher have plastic attachments that collect dishwasher gunk. We have to use a screwdriver to unscrew each of the 4 plastic corners to keep the pitcher clean. Recently, one of those 4 plastic corners broke off unexpectedly. Furthermore, this blender has never blended ice well. I would not purchase this blender again.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: This would be ok for fruit smoothies. We are using more for veggie juice and although it says it can handle green veggies - it can't. I don't like to chew my green drink so had to send it back.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)

review_text: Terrible performance and lack of power: Does not do its primary job, which is to blend ingredients together to be one.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: Great size, price and power. One problem, the container cracks at the bottom, I brought the first one back because cracks showed up and got another, same problem. I noticed there are clear plastic stickers at the bottom, maybe to keep the cracks from growing I don't know but I didn't want to have the thing break open and have a big mess to clean up.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: As someone else mentioned in their review, this blender takes the "smooth" out of "smoothie." No matter how long I blend, there are still massive chunks in my "smoothie," and it's nearly undrinkable. Look at the variety of user-uploaded photos and you'll see what I mean. Also, this blender was shipped in it's original box, with no discreet packaging whatsoever, so the whole neighborhood (including potential thieves) knew exactly what it was as it sat on my front porch. It also means that the box I have to return it in (the original packaging) is already beat up from shipping the first time. I honestly have no idea how this blender has been so popular. It is the worst blender I have ever used, including other cheaper blenders.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: I liked the way it worked
review_text: I liked the way it worked, but we purchased 2 of them and each one only lasted a month. It started leaking where it attaches to the base. When we returned the 2nd to the same place, we just got our money back. I called Ninja to speak to someone to see if they had any suggestions, the first person said, "Since you went thru 2 of them in such a short time, it is obvious to me that you used it wrong." I let her know that we did not ever put them in the dishwasher or use harsh soap, etc. It was supposed to be able to crush ice and that is when it leaked the most. She suggested that we purchase another one and also the 200 dollar warranty that is good for 90 days. We only paid 80 dollars for it and the warranty does not cover mailing the product back and forth to be fixed. I tried to call back again to see if I could leave a complaint with their survey and she hung up on me. When I tried to call back, they had blocked my number. Because I am bilingual, I called again and chose the Spanish line. This gentleman only offered me to create an account with them so I could receive emails for promotions. I asked if I could leave a complaint and he said there wasn't any way to do that. I went on their website and there wasn't away to leave a complaint. My only other option was to leave one here on Amazon so other people will know that they don't stand behind their products. Very sad these days that no one seems to care about the consumer; only how to make more money from you. My next step is to write a letter by snail-mail since their website does not allow you to leave comments.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: because I HATE THIS BLENDER so much
review_text: This is the first time my three young children are all napping in the afternoon. Of all the (many many) things I could be doing right now, I chose to write this review, because I HATE THIS BLENDER so much. Let's count the ways, shall we? 1) The blade and blade holder is huge and does not allow larger chunks of fruit or vegetables to be placed inside the container. 2) The blades are all placed on the side, and none in the center bottom of the blade holder, meaning there is no centrifugal force, meaning that the blades scatter the components of your smoothie all over the container, instead of towards the center bottom of the container. This means that you cannot open the lid to add more liquid or fruit as it is blending. 3) The blades are not locked into place and fall out when you pour 4) It is unnecessarily loud, heavy, and clunky. 5) It does not blend properly. It is about as effective as a mortar and pestle. So in the spirit of fairness, I gave this thing two stars as it does sort of blend things and if you want to use it to make fruit smoothies, I suppose it does the job. However, if you want to make any creamy soups, vegetable smoothies, or sauces you are better off with a regular $30 Oster. My cheap blender does a more thorough job and gets less dirty. I finally thought I was rid of this nightmare when it (after only a year, with maybe bi weekly use) it crapped out on me. The manufacturer offered to send me a new motor, but I was to pay the $30 shipping. Thanks but no thanks. Verdict: Not even as good as a cheap blender. Does kind of blend.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: It blends, but I wouldn't buy it again
review_text: I saw several reviews of this blender accompanied by pictures of lacerations. I thought to myself, "I've been using food processors and other kitchen tools that have sharp, removable blades for years with no problems...." Well, I have managed to avoid any injuries, however I have more sympathy for those people than I did before for the following two reasons: 1) the three tiers of blades mean that there is no safe way to dry this without blades sticking up in the air (unlike a knife or a food processor blade where you can lay it flat). Standing it upright the way it sits in the carafe will make it prone to tipping over. 2) the top part where you must hold the blade is small, tapered, and difficult to grip firmly with wet hands. My other complaint is that because of the three-tiered blade assembly, it is impossible to safely push things down into the blender. I make smoothies five days a week and the kale that I used to just press down to the bottom so that other ingredients would fit, I now have to blend for a moment to make room. Not a huge chore, but it slows me down. I don't love the locking lid and I fear the plastic moving parts will break before the blender wears out, but I've been using this several days a week for five months and that's still working fine. Bottom line, it blends reliably, I'm not going to replace it, but I wouldn't buy it again.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: here- but I think this blender really sucks. It will chip ice- I’ll give it that- ...
review_text: Sorry to go against the grain, here- but I think this blender really sucks. It will chip ice- I’ll give it that- but spinach, pumpkin and sunflower seeds-even chunky peanut butter are left in huge, straw-blocking chunks- even after running on high for 5-7 minutes. My husband says the blade design does not create centrifugal force to suck the ingredients to the bottom and pulverize them. ? All I know is it won’t chop the ingredients I’ve listed above. :(

I decided to return mine after 1 use.

What greens? Just like it! I will be buying the larger Nutri Bullet next.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: HATE IT! So let me start by saying that ...
review_text: HATE IT! So let me start by saying that I had a REAL ninja before this one. I dropped it and broke it so here I go and purchase this one for a great deal. Unfortunately when this blender arrived and from the very first time i used it, once i turn it on to blend the contents splash out through the top. I guess The lid doesnt fit properly or maybe its the rubber on the lid that isnt good. EITHER way in order for it not to splash out, i need to tightly hold down the lid while it blends. AND WHEN ITS TIME TO POUR, im supposed to easily lift the corner and pour. HOWEVER when i pour it comes pouring out around the whole lid making a huge mess. I have to remove the entire lid and blade in order to free pour. BIG WASTE OF MY MONEY AND TIME.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_header: Am I the only one who doesn't like this blender?
review_text: I am surprised at how many stars this blender has... I have had it for two years. I purchased it excitedly after my cheap one gave out. I am disappointed. It does not have different blending options such as crush, blend, puree, etc. It does not completely blend up items like spinach or nuts in my smoothies. The lid does not stay down tight on its own causing the machine to stop blending and I have to hold down the lid with some force in order to use. I do like it for times when I still want to leave bigger chunks such as when making salsa. But as my only blender it does not cut it. Also, it is hard to clean the underside of the pitcher (somehow I have stuff under there?) and the lid has a crevice in the pour spout that is hard to get clean. :(

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
review_text: My beloved (and expensive) Breville recently broke, and after much researching, decided to get this as a replacement. The pitcher definitely feels and sounds cheap/thin like it wants to break. I swear every time I use it, the ice cubes are going to crack it. I use it mostly for protein powder shakes after the gym. Unfortunately the square shape means that powder gets in the corners and stays there. Also, despite using every possible setting, I can't get it to blend the ice well. I always feel the need to the shake a bit as bigger ice chips always remain. I always hand wash (which is easy - yay) this immediately after using and after just a month, condensation is collecting in the handle. Not cool. I do like the spout opening in the lid, which ensures that big blobs of shake or smoothie don't make messes as you pour. This is an ok blender, but feels like it wants to break and I'm not impressed with its functionality. Prob wouldn't buy again.

product_name: ninja professional blender (bl610)
