product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: Caused cystic acne!!!! I just started taking this....only about a week now but started to develop this rashy, cystic acne on my cheeks and jawline. I woke up on day 4 or 5 with a painful large red bump on my cheek and I first thought it was an insect bite. By the end of the day my face had erupted with 7 large red painful bumps on my cheeks and a line of rashy bumps along my jawline. I have never experienced this kind of eruption before and I am on the verge of a panic attack because it looks horrible and it hurts. So in my head, I start to run through my skin care regiment and I'm feeling really betrayed by my skin care products because my skin had been looking really great lately....it was smooth and clear and soft. I was baffled because I hadn't changed anything in my skin care or diet. Then it hit me.....the only thing I had changed was taking the Viviscal! I hadn't really researched the side effects of this product which is kind of unusual for me but after realizing it was the only change I had made and then hello horrible painful red bumps all over my face!! I did a quick search and bingo....cystic acne can be a side effect. I don't know how many people have this reaction but I think it's a pretty common thing because the company has a response that bodies need time to adjust to supplements but I do take other supplements and I have never had side effects that resulted in skin eruptions. I have stopped taking the Viviscal.

review_text: After reading the positive and negative reviews, I thought I would give it a try and hoping will get positive results. I ordered two boxes to get me started. But after taking it a week later, I noticed my hair was falling out way too much. It got to the point where I was freaking out because I saw my hair thinning quickly and got frequent headaches, legs and back pains. I returned the unopened box and will try to return the one I opened.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: Why, why oh why do we lose our hair? There's not just one answer which implies that there's not just one solution. I suppose reasons to include diet, hormones, stress, lack of circulation to the scalp, auto immunity, exposure to toxins, infection. I think this product might be effective for chronic dieters. Assuredly, I am not marine protein deficient. I eat a lot of fish. But this product does contain shark protein. I don't eat shark. May be you recall something from the 1990's or '80's when there was a buzz about shark cartilage being used to treat cancer patients. May this stuff is good for some people. I can't say definitively that it's helped. Some people love it. Perhaps they were protein deficient. As for me, I rather eat a lot of fish. It's tasty. In the mean time, I'm looking for other hair loss solutions.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: Horrible experience with these supplements. As far as growth and thickness, I saw the beginning of some positive effects after a few weeks of twice daily doses. These supplements are documented as possibly interfering with estrogen levels, and I began to have all sorts of symptoms. Viviscal is the only new element in my usual (and very healthy) routine so I am attributing all the problems to it. After about 3 weeks, I was at the point of major mood issues (mood swings, sensitivity, anxiety) and noticeable fatigue. I had trouble sleeping as well, which is very unusual for me. I am horrified at the side effects and regret having put this formula into my body. Absolutely awful experience that no amount of hair growth is worth. I threw these pricey pills in the trash.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: This isn't a review. I haven't tried Viviscal. I'm reading the reviews. The information that's missing in most of the reviews is the age of user, ethnic background, and conditions that may be factoring into your hair loss. I'm 49 years old and premenopausal. My hair loss started about a year ago. As an African-American, I thought that if I stopped processing my hair with relaxers and dyes, the hair loss minimize. WRONG!!! It's gotten worse. I would really like to hear from perimenopausal women about how this product work for them. Thank you.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: This is a scam!! Everyone person on here agreeing that it works is not real or is delusional. I came across an article that talked about counterfeit products and they told me to watch out for the ingredients and lot numbers of Viviscal products. Well, low and behold, I reviewed my box's ingredients from this company and the real Viviscal box's ingredients and they differ. They are selling this as the original product and it's not . Also be aware that the product's ingredients are lies and can be dangerous to your health (meaning, it could be paint thinner and chemicals). I have since then bought the real deal and the taste is so different!! Watch out, you have been warned!! -I am a Registered Nurse and I have learned my lesson.

review_header: Since the recommended dosage is 2 tablets per day
review_text: I was about to buy Viviscal Extra Strength when I noticed in the list of ingredients that each tablet contains 10 mg of iron. Since the recommended dosage is 2 tablets per day, that amounts to 20 mg of iron per day. For post-menopausal women iron supplements are not recommended due to increased risk of iron build-up after menopause. I wonder if the manufacturer considered the recommendations for iron intake by older women. Does anybody have an opinion on that?

review_text: I have been using Viviscal purchased directly from the Viviscal site for about 5, 5.5 months. I am in my late 30s and have 3 kids and my once long hair has become much less full and doesn't grow like it use to. It literally seems to be at a standstill or just growing very slowly. The only reason I am going to continue to take this to the end of my package is because my hair does feel softer and healthier. So maybe it encourages hair growth and hair health, but does not make your hair grow. On to the next... :(

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: Not what's it promoted to be...
review_text: Viviscal hair tablets/pills Ok. My boyfriend says I need to blog more, so hair (here) goes. I am a Jamaican with natural kinky hair. Nothing special, my hair is about neck length. Hair care routine - none; and no I don't sleep in satin head piece, or comb or plait my hair in any protective style before bed. I am too tired at night for all of that. I just go to sleep. So I thought I should care for my hair more, as the once a week shampooing and the occasional Castro oil and jojoba oil mix alone would not help me to achieve my hair goal. My hair goal - shoulder length, incredibly thick natural hair. Think Diana Ross. So I began taking Viviscal tablets after having done some research on the product. I have been taking two Viviscal tablets twice daily for about 9 months now. The changes to my hair during this time are as follows: Months 1 to 3 nothing; my hair was shredding due to an improper Castro oil and coconut oil mix, Viviscal did not stop the shredding. Six months later I did not see any changes to my hair's length or thickness. Shredding continued. I however liked the way it look; my hair started to shiny and so continued to take the tablets. Besides I was not expecting overnight results. The benefits reportedly would appear six months and beyond. In months 7th to 9th, I began renovating my kitchen (January 2014). I am a creature of habit. My habit is to sit at the dinner table and sometime during dinner take my Viviscal tablets. At the time of my kitchen renovation I could not find a plate to eat in and as such seldom sat at my dinner table for dinner. So I did not take my tablets for 2 months, which by the way was now packed away in a carton box long with my dishes. What happen to my hair? Nothing. My hair did not start or stop growing, neither did it looked better or worse. (In my opinion). It looked the same way it did when I was taking Viviscal months earlier. I was about to stop future deliveries of the product, when I learnt another three months supply of visvical was on its way. What!? I didn't even finish the last three months supply I have on hand. (I made a mental note to self that I must track by subscription orders better, as I grieved over the excess supply of the product). Any way I digress. I went back on Viviscal (April? 2015) and I must say my hair looked shiny, feels thick and healthy and it was no longer shredding. I continued to sleep without satin hair piece or any special styling before bed. The good news I was not suffering from any breakage. I dropped coconut oil from my hair regime. If you can call what I do I regime. A few months later I got frustrated no results; I practically gave away an unopened box of Visviscal. In August of this year (2016) I started taking biotin (10000mg) and pregnacare tablets. (No I am not pregnant.) I am so far enjoying the results which came within a month of use. I will let you all know when I obtain my hair goal. Cheers Nikki Ps: Rich, I just completed a blog; I shared my experience with the world. Happy? I am net-socializing.. lol

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: Do not buy - contains endangered species!
review_text: I was ready to try this, based on customer reviews, but realized when looking at the ingredients list that it contains shark. Sharks are well-known to be an endangered species, so I cannot in any good conscience buy this product. Sharks have a scary reputation based on misinformation, but even if they were everything that media makes them out to be, their numbers are dwindling (due to humans) and it is up to us to keep them safe. Barbaric practices such as shark fin soup are banned in many areas now, due to awareness of the shark's plight. I'm not going to consume something that actively kills an endangered creature just for vanity. That's a terrible reason and a sad choice. I'm actually surprised it's being sold at all. PLEASE don't buy this product.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: Ireland-made pills are better if you can secure them. Watch out for breakouts!
review_text: It's been about 20 days and I've only been taking one a day (at night) because the tablets were causing my skin to break out a lot. I'm not sure if I've noticed a difference but a good friend said my hair texture was less frizzy. My nails are super strong and long, however. I am confident that I'll see improvement in my hair with continued use. Update: The pills in first batch I ordered were wide and flat and made in Ireland (supposedly). I definitely have noticed a difference in my hair quality since I've been taking them. Just ordered my second box and the packaging looks like a knockoff, as well as the pills being smaller in diameter and thicker and made in the US (supposedly). I emailed Viviscal the lot numbers and expiration dates so hopefully they can confirm which batch is real. I will be returning these pills pending their response. There is a reason the price is significantly cheaper than the pills at the store. (First order is the box/pills on the right and the lot number on the bottom; second order is left/top. I think the second one is the fake.) Update #2: I checked the lot numbers and expiration dates with the company and they told me that both boxes were legit but they have two factories, which would account for the differences in the pills. However, the second box (made in the US) is giving me really bad, unrelenting acne. The first box from Ireland also caused breakouts but that subsided after a week or so whereas this time it won't stop. If I can consistently get the pills made in Ireland, I'll keep taking them cause they definitely do seem to be making some difference. If not, the acne is a dealbreaker.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: Using this since 2016 and yes, it does work
review_text: Ok, I held off writing this review until I could say that I have been using this product for a while. So, I have been using this product since March 2016 (that would be just about 2 years). I have a thyroid condition which I think is somewhat responsible for my hair thinning. I'm 52, so I'm also expecting to get some thinning just due to age, but I had started to see more hair loss that I liked. My thick ponytails were getting quite thin. I did some research and found this product. I have been taking it faithfully twice per day for the past two years. it took some time for me to see a difference but now I can honestly say that my hair feels much thicker than it has in years. Its still not quite as thick as when I was 20 years old, but there is absolutely no sign of thinning spots and it looks and feels very full when I touch it. I'm also noticing a lot of new hair growth, many little hairs growing all over my head. I noticed this more because almost at the same time I started taking this product I decided to grow out my bangs. Now that they are all gone I am noticing how many little hairs are wanting to replace my bags. Its actually very exciting to see all this growth. If you want immediate results then maybe this is not the product for you, but if you have a little time then go ahead and try it. I am happy that I did and I will continue to use it .

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: Hello out there! I am going to settle something for a lot of people. Especially the ones who wrote about the product being fake. It’s not fake it’s quite real because I have used it for 6 or 7 years! I’ve been a licensed cosmetologist for many years and still practicing in Wash, DC. Here is what I can tell you from experience. I found the directions not to be quite as straight forward as they should be. You have to follow the directions as stated from the beginning. Then decrease to one a day. And then continue forever. I have introduced it to a good number of clients. There are 2 is hasn’t worked for. One client was determined and all of a sudden after 2 years a significant amount of hair popped out around the hairline. So it works you have to decide how much time your willing to invest. From what I’ve seen give it at least a year. I myself stopped after some months and then realized it was working and went back on it. My clients have done the same. And it continues to work as long as you take it. I actually just use it a couple days per week now and won’t stop. Even my co workers see the difference in my hair and refer their clients to it. You could spend your money on worse things bedsides getting better hair! Give it a try!

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: Really helps if you have alopecia
review_text: PRO: It works for alopecia areata I had alopecia on over 50% of my scalp, eyebrows, and eyelashes. I've been through it all: steroid injections, creams, acupuncture, etc. - nothing really worked for me. My acupuncturist suggested taking Viviscal in conjunction with treatment from my dermatologist (I'm doing laser treatment with an excimer machine). After 1 month, I started growing some spots of hair. It's been over 6 months now and my eyebrows have grown back, my eyelashes are no longer falling out, and the hair on my scalp is starting to fill back in. I do believe it was a combination of the laser and the viviscal. The Viviscal kept my hair strong and expedited the growth process, while the laser targeted the antibodies from attacking the hair follicle. If you're just noticing some spots, I HIGHLY recommend this product. CON: Increased unwanted hair on chin and upper lip.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: I had hair loss for about 5 months before starting to take these; lost about 30-50% of my hair due to stress/shock. (I'm 38.) Along with MSM vitamin tablets and evening primrose oil, I take one of these Viviscal tablets per day. They're slim and super easy to swallow. It seems to have stopped my hair loss completely and it happened within just a few weeks of taking these. Now hopefully I'll be able to start growing it all back. I'd recommend taking these supplements along with the other two (MSM and evening primrose oil), since this trio combo seemed to work for me. I hope it works for someone else too.

review_header: Dont be skeptical, spend $30 a month for one year & you'll tell everyone else to, too.
review_text: I am not one to write reviews, but since you can't trust all reviews online and I am a real human who was stressed over my hair loss I had after moving from sunny Vitamin D filled Florida to Vitamin D deficient NYC- I could perhaps spread some hope to those out there who may be skeptical. I started taking Viviscal June 28th, I am no angel with taking both pills every day, sometimes I forget, quite honestly, however, the results are amazing. I had a friend in town whose hair looked incredible and she happened to be taking Viviscal for 3 years total and highly recommended it, so I read review after review and thought I would give it a try. - Now I have new hair growth along my edges where I never had hair grow before - I also have 3-4 inches of new hair growth that sprouts from the top of my head and makes me look like I got electrocuted if I don't hairspray it down. - I read a blind study where they say the results are most noticeable at 9 months - 1 year, but I will say that I noticed a sure difference within 2 months. I am really excited to see what my hair is going to look like in one year ( next dec)

review_header: SO FAR SO GOOD 3 month update
review_text: Began taking this May 1st. It's too soon to tell if my hair is growing yet, but my nails could be used as a screw driver if I couldn't find a real one! Good bye Rogaine hello Viviscal, my new best friend. Oh yes, my nails are still growing like weeds ... no complaint there! And to think I was once thinking of getting a wig :-). Try it, you'll love it! No aside effects, only praise after taking for just beginning the 3rd month. 4 months now, (Sept 4) . product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: These vitamins are the best supplements I've ever purchased for my hair
review_text: These vitamins are the best supplements I've ever purchased for my hair! I did my research before making the decision to try these and they did not disappoint. I was looking for a supplement that had a proven clinical/scientific study, not a fly by night, to good to be true hair vitamin. My hair grows at a pretty good rate as it is, so I can't say much about this supplement for growth, Some years back, my hair has lost major density after my Dr had me on alot of antibiotics for a condition that resulted in me having to have a hysterectomy. Nothing I did helped thicken it. My hair was so thin, I didn't like wearing it straight ( I'm African American)because you could see through it. Now, My hair is so thick that it takes upwards of an entire day to wash, condition, detangle and style it..and my hair is short! ( I clipper cut all my hair off 10/2016). My hair is now over 4" all over which averages to over 1/2" a month. If you're looking for a gimmicky product to grow your hair fast, This isn't it, but if you're looking for something to help you grow thick, healthy hair along with good eating habits, You've found the holy grail. Give it 3 months before making a sound decision on whether this is the product for you. You need to also take into consideration that If you have genetically thin hair, this product will not create thick hair. This product helps wake up dead hair follicles that previously had hair growing within it. I've been using this product since February and it's the best thing since sliced bread.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: my skin is in great shape for my age
review_text: My hair had been thinning considerably over the past 2-3 years to the degree that I was feeling self-conscious. Being in my 50s I imagined it was because of age, however, my skin is in great shape for my age. Six weeks ago I decided to get proactive and heard about Viviscal from a hairdresser, bought it that day and have been taking it religiously, and voila, I have a significant amount of regrowth and am thrilled! Unlike other reviewers I have not gained weight, suffered headaches or had any side effects. Important to note that I also did extensive research and discovered a condition called "traction alopecia" which I suspect was contributing to my case of thinning hair. For the past several years I have been sporting a pair of metal-framed wraparound sunglasses that were doubling as a hair band to keep my locks away from my face. Shades on top of head is my signature look, even on rainy days or while inside the house, at my desk, etc. About the same time as starting on Viviscal I stopped pushing my shades up and down on my head, which alleviated all that tightness and pressure, rubbing and snatching strands of hair from the top of my head. In short, I think that the combination of Viviscal and removing the traction of the sunglasses are to be credited with my success story.

review_text: My hair was getting thin and lank and I figured it was just old age (over 60), but I decided to try Viviscal. I knew it would take a while, so I just incorporated two pills into my daily habits and forgot about it. It was perhaps 6 or 8 months later that I realized how much thicker my hair was, how much bounce and shine it had. Was this stuff really working? I had no other explanation for it. It is pricey, but of course I couldn't stop. I now take one Viviscal a day in the morning and a biotin supplement at night. Biotin is MUCH cheaper, and is the major ingredient in Viviscal. I have been on this regime for four or five years and my hair has remained lush and full. I will never stop!

review_header: The only thing that has worked
review_text: This stuff works! End of story! I noticed some thinning hair on the top front and sides of my head right around my face after I decided to take a year off from the pill after 15 years of constant use. Bad idea. Horrible idea. But anyway, one of the many nasty things that happened was my hair fell out. I'm only 33 and my curly hair has always been thick, so I was a tiny bit devastated. I got back on the pill (not because of my hair) and tried some different (expensive) shampoos and vitamins with maybe a little difference but nothing to brag about. Came across these and read some amazing reviews and crossed my fingers and ordered some. I'm almost finished with my 2nd box of pills, I have taken them religiously twice and day and I can't sing it's praises loud enough. My nails are thicker and harder than they've ever been in my entire life, and the little fuzzy curly baby hairs around my face are impossible to dispute. I know it's going to take a while and I will probably never get back to how my hair used to be, but this product has been a real self esteem booster and I will continue to take it as long as it's available (hopefully forever).

review_text: Was developing the post-menopausal thinning of my hair which has always been thick --- now even my hairstylist has noticed new hair growth.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: No one is a bigger skeptic than me when it comes to hair growth treatments. I've tried expensive shampoos and different scalp sprays. Nothing made a huge difference. It's a scary fact that one out of every two women will experience hair loss/thinning....and of course I am one of them. What lit a fire under me was when I made a video of me opening my Christmas gifts from a friend who lives in another country. (It's how we do Christmas, being so far apart.) I saw the video of myself, and I already knew I had thinning hair, but it REALLY showed up in that video, my scalp was shining through my dark hair. I went online and started searching out all the different treatments that weren't shampoos or sprays. I read reviews from many different websites before deciding to try Viviscal. The reviews were pretty much 95% positive. And now here is my review. I had really given up on anything really helping. I'd already bought a topper and hair extensions (that didn't match my natural color, and are still in the box because I was putting off bleaching then dying them), and even some wigs. I hated the wigs, they were hot and itchy, and they didn't look natural. So down to my last hope, I got a box of Viviscal (locally, the price was better at the time). I kid you not, I'm only 2 weeks in and I can see a huge difference. My scalp is still visible, but nothing like it was. (I will be adding pics later on, of my hair NOW, and pics of my hair in a month or two.) I had my doubts about this working. Nothing else had really made a huge difference. I am so glad I took a chance on this! This is life changing, and I'm only two weeks in. I had my husband look at my hair to get his opinion, and he was blown away by how much less scalp was showing. I went out today and for the first time in years, I wasn't embarrassed to be seen. It's very traumatic to lose your hair. I have nothing to gain, but I'm telling you, if you've tried everything (and even if you haven't), please give this a try. I had pretty much given up. Now I know there is hope. And in only two weeks!! I expected it to take months to see a difference, if I was going to see a difference at all. In short, I am blown away by the results. I've spent the last 10 years trying to make peace with my thinning hair, and that just never happened. Then I tried covering it up with colored dry shampoos (that get all over your pillow case). I tried a lot of things. And not one of them did what Viviscal has done for me. So far I've not seen any changes in my nails, but I've read where some people have said their nails got better. Mine haven't, but I am ok with that. I'll be signing up on here to get a box sent every month. Btw, my box says Made In The US, it's not the made in Ireland that so many people say is better. I can't imagine what 'better' would be! I'm getting my hair back, and I never thought that would happen. If you're on the fence, just give it a try. If I'd tried this first, I'd have saved myself hundreds of dollars on products that barely worked, if at all. ETA: Something I left out something that is worth mentioning. I can't see the hair on the top of my head well, so I had my husband look at it for me and tell me what he saw. My thinning starts at my hairline and goes to the crown of my head, so it's about a 4-5" square on the top of my head that is thinning the worst. My husband described the new growth to me. He said it's thicker than the hair that's already there, ie, the hair I have that hasn't fallen out. My hair fall has been dramatically reduced. As far as how much longer my hair has gotten, I can't really say for sure. I honestly wasn't worried about length, I was more concerned with thickness. My hair is about 2" above my waistline. I have a LOT of stands of hair that are about 3" long, I'm guessing that has to be the new growth, as my hair is all one length, no layers. My hair normally grows fast anyway, and I do think I've had a growth spurt since I started using Viviscal. I normally do a big chop every summer of anywhere from 4" to a foot. (It irritates me when I'm tucking my shirts in and I have to pull my hair out of the back of my jeans!) I think I am going to skip the chop this year and just keep my ends trimmed, just to see how far this will go since I've started using Viviscal. My hair loss is hormonal (I'm 51) and also stress has been pretty rough for me for many years. I have very little grey. My husband said the new hair coming in is darker. (I never color my hair. My natural color is between dark brown and black.) I have to admit that I don't take this as it's prescribed. I take 2 together when I get up in the morning. The only thing that I consider to be a side effect is that I have been dealing with breakouts that I normally don't have, but they're not bad. I had a breakout a few days ago and I'm already clearing up. ETA: I've added a before and an after picture taken a month apart. There is actually more scalp showing in the before picture on the crown of my head, my hair is just laid back over it. I wasn't able to get the same lighting for both pictures. I have a ton of new growth in the second picture, and my hair is so much thicker than it was a month before, so obviously I'm getting new growth all over, not just on the top, though the top is the worst. I had some errands to do today, and for the first time in about 15 years, someone complimented my hair! I'm really excited to get to the six month mark, I think I will have much thicker hair and much less scalp showing. I don't know if my results are typical, because this is just one month of taking Viviscal. I don't mean to sound like a spokesperson, because I'm not. I'd just thought these kinds of results weren't possible. I may be back in 6 months with another picture. Thanks!

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: After having two surgeries 6 months apart my hair started falling out from the general anesthesia. At 29 I had lost 50% of my hair in about 3 months. I've just completed month 1 of viviscal and my hair has stopped falling out as much and I have a lot of new growth (see picture). I am so happy with my results and have now signed up for the subscription with target so I can use my red card. Can't believe target actually beat Amazon on pricing. The only problem I have with this is an ethical one... these contain shark. I'm a vegetarian and I don't feel good about taking these given there is cruelty involved. I wish the amino mar ingredient was synthetic and not just ground up shark. These also have a very fishy/ fish food like flavor and smell which is unpleasant but not intolerable. Minus one star for everything described in this paragraph. These don't seem to bother my stomach however I do always take with food. For the first month I was taking both pills in the morning. On the second package I reread the instructions and have now switched to taking them as recommended, one in the morning and one at night. Still had results taking both pills at once but I generally prefer to follow instructions for use provided by the manufacturer.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: It Works - It Really, Really Works!!!
review_text: I've been using Viviscal Extra Strength 2x a day since June 24, 2016 - a little over six months today - and felt it was time to post a review and share my results with the product. I use it because I have hypothyroidism which caused me to lose a lot of hair. My hair loss has been going on for awhile but started getting worse in the past two years. My endocrinologist had been monitoring my hormone levels (TSH, T4, T3, etc.) and tweaking my medication to keep my levels optimum, but the hair loss continued no matter what we did. Finally, my doctor suggested my hair loss may just be a natural result of aging and not thyroid related at all. Well, I wasn't about to just sit back and go bald without fighting - I'm only 51! And when I say "go bald", I'm not exaggerating. I had a receding hairline like a man and the top of my head was so thin that I was getting scalp sunburns (I live in Florida so this was a definite issue). Late one night I saw an infomercial for Viviscal. I don't generally pay attention to products sold that way (I figure if they're really that good, why don't they just sell them in stores?) but decided to give Viviscal a shot. I ordered it from Amazon because it was much cheaper. As I said, I began taking it on June 24th. For probably about 2 months I didn't really notice a difference growth-wise but did notice less hair falling out when I shampooed. After the 3rd month, my hairdresser mentioned that I had a lot of new growth on top and in the front over my forehead- very short hairs that I had seen but I thought they were breakage from styling (I was constantly playing with my hair, trying to come up with a style that would disguise the hair loss). Now I'm at 6 months out and I have to say Viviscal is definitely working for me. The hair loss on top/in front? Not even noticeable at all anymore. I'm absolutely amazed at how much it's grown in. It's probably about 4 inches long now and for the first time in years I'm able to pull my hair back into a ponytail. Some observations: My hair has always been wavy, but now it's very curly. I have no idea if/how Viviscal did this, but I don't care - I love it. Secondly, the texture of my hair has changed somewhat. It was coarse & dry but now it feels pretty normal other than the curliness. And thirdly, I am still experiencing hair loss when I shampoo my hair but it's honestly nothing like it used to be. I used to remove a huge hairball from the tub after every shower. Now I'd say I remove that much in a week. All in all, I am thrilled with Viviscal and will continue using it despite the cost, although at some point I may just start taking it once a day as maintenance. I highly recommend the product and would be happy to answer any questions about my use of it.

review_text: I was getting discouraged when I did not see improvement in a couple of months but I kept on taking them. But it is now at the end of my forth month and finally am seeing results. I have new hair growing where my hairline was receding and my hair is definitely getting thicker. The trick is giving it enough time and not giving up. I think it is also making my nails grow which is a bonus. I am a 69 year old female. Wish they would make the price a little easier to afford, but since they do work it is worth it.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_header: It works! Only been using for 3 weeks!
review_text: I never write reviews, but just had to for this. Over the course of 6 years, my hair has fallen out three times due to stress called telogen effluvium. I finally got my hair back from the last one three years ago and was enjoying beautiful hair until I noticed it was falling out again! I was devasted, almost suicidal. This shouldn't happen three times to young 28 year old person! I could deal with it the first two times, but not for a third time. I don't have bald spots, just overall loss of density. I knew what triggered it every time, and each time was emotional stress due to a break up. Stupid, but it affected me. Anyways, I raced to a dermatologist and she suggested Viviscal. I have only been using it for 3 weeks now and I see a difference! My hair just feels thicker, it's shinier and I swear, filling in near my part and sides. The shedding has dramatically decreased too! I went from being sooooo depressed about this to feeling ok again. I don't look sick, as anyone who experiences hair loss knows your hair looks scraggly and frizzy while it's shedding. My hair just looks good! I have no side effects such as nausea or acne. I am praying this continues. Viviscal saved my sanity, truly. My only question and concern is does hair fall out again when you stop? Update: 12/23/16 I will come on here to update every few weeks if I can. I have now been taking Viviscal for 4 weeks. I think I spoke too soon. For some reason, the strengthening and thickening effects dont seem to be lasting. I only finished the first pack in the box and started the second. When I started the second, I noticed my hair felt weak again, so I opened the third pack in the same box and started that one. Its still the same. It seems as if the dosage is different?? The first pack worked amazing. I ordered directly from Viviscal, not from Amazon so I know I have the real deal. The shedding is still less and I do notice a little of improvement. I'll continue taking it with the hopes I will see amazing results. It has only been a month.

product_name: viviscal extra strength hair nutrient tablets, 90-tablets
review_text: Okay, so i recieved my two boxes of Viviscal on October 18th and begin taking as directed the following day. I had previously heard good things about the product and after taking biotin for over a year with little to no results concerning my thinning hair, i decided to switch to Viviscal. Within the first two weeks i started breaking out pretty badly but by the fourth week my ache had cleared up completely. The first month was.....slow, i didnt see any promising results pertaining to my hair, my nails also werent growing; which was the one thing biotin did do. But after about a month and a half, my hair started growing substantially. I literally have not seen my hair look this full and healthy in about a decade. The sides of my hair, which were thinning more profusely than the rest have also filled in quite nicely. As far as length, it does seem to have grew a bit longer then it normally would have in that time frame, but more impresseively, i feel a lot more hair on my head.

Also, only due to the obviously not very bright packager at Amazon, this item was shipped in a huge box with 40 pounds of cat litter, so, yeah, it got crushed. ADDENDUM : Received a replacement for the corroded one, however, the replacement was defective. It would say it's little statements, but the light would only flash now and then, briefly. It, too, was returned for a refund. After two bad units, I give up.

product_name: the official bs button
review_header: Quality not what it once was
review_text: I bought this to replace an old worn out bulls*** button. We have had a lot of fun with the old one for many years. The volume on the new button is so low that the effect of the button is somewhat lost. Very disappointed. Even the color red is not the bright color in the picture.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: If you buy this, prepare to return it or do maintenance or return it. Upon receipt, BS button would not work. I removed the screw to gain access to the batteries. Here I found two JUNK quality batteries which were dead and had leaked electrolyte in the battery compartment as well as corroded battery contacts. I cleaned up the Alkaline using white vinegar and swabs and burnished the corroded contacts. I put in two Duracell AAA batteries and replaced the cover and screw. All is now fine. However as not everyone is a technician, of course you will have to return the unit. At this price and my time, it was better to fix it. I say to the Manufacturer, "Clean Up Your Act and get a quality battery"!!! This is the second of these I have bought and the first was fine however, the batteries had a very short life. Now, I know why.

review_text: Got this for my husband's office at his dealership, but now he brings it with him everywhere. A couple weeks ago things got pretty tense between my husband and our waitress at The Olive Garden. So much so that he refused to communicate with her. Every time she tried to speak he would press the "BS Button." Eventually, the manager arrived and offered to comp our desserts, but my husband called "BS" and hit the button again. It was uncomfortable, but definitely a better alternative to the fits he used to throw before we got the "BS Button" I'm here picking up a third replacement because he snuck it into Friday night Shabbat services and the Rabbi confiscated it mid-service (which was very embarrassing).

review_text: First, it's not as pictured. The one I received has a black concave tapered base. The biggest problem that I have is that the internal piece that connects the battery to the unit that creates the sound disconnects very easily. It's not too difficult to fix, but why should you have too, right? After fixing it a few times, I just hung it on my cubical wall as a decoration. It still gets some laughs, which is why it was bought I suppose. Also, it is LOUD. You will probably want to put some tape or something over the speaker to dampen it if you are in an office. Just a heads up...

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: The speaker is really tinny and pretty poor. And the phrases are good. There just aren't enough of them. I want more! It's a lot of fun.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: Died after 2 days... 'nuff said ...But assuming you fix it or use it in its short life-span, this product comes with several different (lame) 'BS' quotes. I was hoping for a simple "Bull S---!". You're better off yelling it out at other people rather than saying it to yourself for having bought it.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: Got this as a gift for my step-mother, and she loved it, but unfortunately it broke the next day. Definitely not worth it.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: Voice is difficult to hear. Low volumne & not adjustable. When I say BULLSH*t I mean it ! Wimpy! Looks good sounds lousy.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I have a friend that bought a "no" button and I think that's great. I bought this thinking it would be similar but the volume is low, the speech quality is poor, it only has about 5 phrases which are not inspiring like "warning, bulls**t detected". This would be far better if modeled from the "no" button - simply repeating the word in many different voices and different emotional tones. Buy the "no" button. You'll enjoy it more.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I returned this item for two reasons: 1.) It said batteries included, I saw batteries nowhere in the box so I assumed they were already in the device but it wouldn't work 2.) when I tried to open up the device to see if the batteries were in there and working, the screws were so worn down that I couldn't get the screwdriver to say in the slots. I returned it immediately.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: First of all these are WAY WAY smaller than you would think, and secondly, I bought two for gag gifts, and BOTH stopped working after a day. Total waste of money.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I bought two of these buttons for gag Christmas presents (the other being the WTF? button) and I find them both to be crap. The voices used are very irritating and the comments are plain stupid. I'm very disappointed this these purchases.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: It's a well made product that will last the user for a long long time, but this particular model wasn't among the best as far as the actual phrases it says are concerned.

Definitely will not be purchasing or recommending this to anyone. The only thing I could do with it was use it in a white elephant gift at Christmas.

review_text: Button breaks really fast. Cheaply made! Would have been great if it had lasted longer! Would have been great if it had been made better.

product_name: the official bs button
review_header: Not as pictured or described...and beware, it makes sounds WHILE SHIPPING.
review_text: I ordered this for a friend as a gag gift. There are several problems with this order. First of all, the button is NOTHING like the one shown in the pictures OR DESCRIBED in the text. They describe it as lighting up and buzzing. It does neither. The phrases they list? It says none of them. The look of the item? Not even close. But that's not the worst part. They shipped it with the batteries in and ACTIVATED. And it was shipped in a flimsy package (not really a box). This meant that just touching the box pushed the button. I had this delivered to my OFFICE. It was saying BULLSHIT phrases over and over again as they brought it to my desk. I'm lucky I wasn't fired as we can't use that kind of language here. This seller really needs to be more careful and accurately describe the item. Also, do SOMETHING in shipping the keeps the button from playing.

product_name: the official bs button
review_header: Received different product than ordered in picture
review_text: I have a Bulls**t button, exactly as pictured when I bought the product. However, a different version of the button arrived today and I am very disappointed. It has some different phrases and a different voice than the one I currently have. Don't want to go through the return process but needless to say I will not be purchasing from this Amazon store again unless this is resolved.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I ordered this button thinking it was the same one as the one in the picture which is the one I've seen before. When it arrived, the button looks somewhat different and the phrases are not as funny as the ones from the button shown in the picture.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I ordered two of these. One is OK and the other did not work. I opened up the battery cover and found one of the batteries had leaked, coating the contact spring with gunk that would not come off. How ironic... I guess I can push the button on the one that works...

product_name: the official bs button

review_header: Arrived with broken package and shorted circuit
review_text: The packaging arrived with cracked plastic and the battery was dead. I replaced the battery and wrapped it up (it was to be a stocking stuffer for christmas), and by the time it was unwrapped 2 days later, the brand new batteries were dead. I understand it's a cheap product, but c'mon... it should at least work for a week before breaking down. (The one or two lines I heard immediately after replacing the batteries were funny and my dad would have really gotten a kick out of the toy, if it had worked...)

product_name: the official bs button

review_text: This was suppose to be a gag gift for a co-worker. Cheap, simple. Now I have to compromise the unopened box as a gift to buy and replace the batteries! Pathetic. Really. In fact, I'm so irritated about it I'm writing a review before I even hear if the gag sounds good.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: The picture shows the button looking like the "easy" button from STAPLES. When i got the item it was a totally different item. It was black and looked nothing like the "easy" button as advertised. It was a totally different item :-(

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: This button has about 5 phrases. Each is different and said in a male voice. Voice sounds somewhat like a robotic, male voice shouting through a bull horn. It's somewhat funny. Does get old fiarly quick though. It's something you'd play with for 20 minutes and then give to a friend so they can have a good laugh and then passing it off to someone else as well. The price tag is reasonable for what you get. It's not an amazing purchase, but for the cost it's not a risky purchase.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I also have the Staples Easy button. The BS button, even though it costs more, does not have the same build quality or tactile click feedback as the lower price Easy button. The BS button feels a bit flimsy, and a bit loose. The quality tactile feel of the Staples button gives more button-pressing satisfaction than this one. The words 'BS' is cheaply printed on the button, while on the Staples button, 'easy' is actually raised. Tip: the Staples button costs less if you buy it from a Staples store. The BS button lights up and gives a few simple phrases such as, "This is 'BS'", or, "Warning, warning, 'BS' alert" with sirens going off. It was a hit at first. Works great when you're with friends who are Staples employees, but outside of that it doesn't get much use as its humor wears off fast.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: I was kind of expecting the same kind of thing that you get with the Staples "That was easy!" button but the stuff that comes out of this thing when you push the button isn't just "BS", it's a bunch of goofy/corny expressions.

product_name: the official bs button
review_header: Good gift, but not much else unless you like these kind of novelties.
review_text: As gag gifts go, this is a pretty okay item. Not too much to be excited about (least for me), but not bad either. It's louder than what I thought it would, so that's a plus. However, I was slightly surprised when I received it. The packaging is different and it's a bit smaller than it looks in the picture. Other than that, it's the same item. Would make a good gift to someone whom you don't know what to get and likes gag gifts/bull****.

product_name: the official bs button
review_text: This thing is hilarious. I have a brother and niece whom are both full of it. My niece has the opposite political views I do (and the rest of my family), but she's only 18. My brother could replace Tom Sawyer in the books, and if I didn't know better, I would think the character was written after him. He apitafies the term "breezy". So, now I have a button to press when they annoy me during family get together, namely the holidays. So why four stars? It isn't loud enough. I'd say it's barely 60 decibels and that is your ear very close to it. 60 decibels is REGULAR speech volume, but my family is not regular. More like 90 decibels and more than that if they try to out talk each other which is a frequent occurrence, especially during the holidays. So, unless we have a moment of silence, it is hard to hear this thing. It would be perfect if it had another 25 decibels. I'd give it 3.5 stars, dropped down only because of volume.

review_text: I had one of these gifted to me, and in turn, I gifted it to someone else. It is THE perfect and most hilarious gag gift ever. It's obvious what it says, but what's more funny is that it says it in several different ways, so every time you push the button, you will get a different version. I keep it on my desk for obvious reasons, but if you ever wanted something that is more funny than the one that says "that was easy", this BS button is it! Beware for lames and those that don't have a good sense of humor, they wouldn't appreciate it. It already comes with batteries and is ready to go out of the package. Needless to say, I love it.

product_name: the official bs button
review_header: Great Deterrent for Telemarketers!!!! Go for it!!!!
review_text: Buy this if you have been driven to distraction by telemarketers calling constantly!!!! I was thrilled to be able to use it first thing this morning on the first of probably many calls which will aggravate and interrupt my day today. Folks, it works. I think the person was so shocked they just immediately hung up without saying a word. YAY!!! I dislike having to use a fairly bad word, but it's not really me, it's a machine, so I'm hoping that makes a difference! But if it gets rid of these calls, I'm all for it!! It seems to be very well made and we love the different ways it says BS, very funny. I would buy another one, but just after I bought it, it went off Prime.......go figure?

product_name: the official bs button
review_header: Extra fun with a few minutes of work
review_text: This toy was very educational- it got me thinking, and inspired creativity. This button is AMAZING! My boss has an easy button, so of course I had to get one too because I'm just that kind of employeelol riiiiight. I wondered if I could swap the guts of an easy button with a BS button so I ordered both on Amazon, and had some fun doing a little creative soldering, trimming of internal plastic (under "easy"), and use of a rubber band to hold the pressure button from the easy button in place on the BS button after soldering the wires (see below for walk-through). A switcheroo when he was out of his office, and presto: an innocuous looking button that lets out a random phrase letting you know what it REALLY was (hint: not easy)! That was easy. DISCLAIMER: I work in an agency with a "high ops-tempo" and difficult cases where "everything is a crisis," and most importantly, a boss who gets my sense of humor. Try this at your own risk. ------ Remove feet from easy button, s... Read more
